alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:17PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Campbell and northern Crook Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 517 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Biddle to 10 miles southwest of Rockypoint to 11 miles southeast of Weston. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Rockypoint around 530 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Lightning Flat, Oshoto and New Haven. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills
